Posts.Content: I have been reading this forum for weeks as I feared my husband would receive bad news; which he has. The initial shock and fear have sunk in and now I just want advice and or hope. We were told if he does nothing he will die in a year. He is only 57! I am not looking to be a widow anytime soon. He started on hormone therapy last week (Casodex 50 mg daily) and got a shot of Eligard yesterday. He will have blood work again in April; which seems so far away, that is also when he will have another Eligard shot. Anyone out there with advanced PC that has any advice or inspiration? Thanks!
Posts.Signature: Age at Diagnosis= 57 November 2012 PSA 45.6, Prostate biopsy positive 12/12, Gleason score 9 December 2012 Bone scan~Mets to Pelvis, Skull, Left Ribs, Spine, Left Kidney CT scan Abdomen and Pelvis~Mets to Bladder, Lymph nodes, Prostate w/ extension to rectum, Left Kidney w/ mild hydronephrosis Started Casadex 12/14, Eligard shot 12/18
Posts.Title: Husband just diagnosed with Advanced PC

Posts.Content: Hello, You all give me hope I feel the same way about April for blood work. I will work on getting that adjusted. We have an appt. scheduled at Fox Chase Cancer center on December 28th. with a Medical Oncologist who specializes in PCa. We seen another Oncologist yesterday regarding the possibility of Radiation for bone pain. The Dr. wants to see if my husband starts to feels some relief with the hormone treatment. I am encouraging my husband to eat more of a raw diet, and join the gym with me. He is agreeable I know he is scared, but I do beleive he will get more engaged and do whatever is needed to enhance his quality of life and survival. His pain seems to come and go, some days he moves around fine and other days he has awful Rib pain and his pelvis is out of whack. He has a lot of fatigue as well. I will continue reading...I will check out the Healing Well forum. Thank you!
Posts.Signature: Age at Diagnosis= 57 November 2012 PSA 45.6, Prostate biopsy positive 12/12, Gleason score 9 December 2012 Bone scan~Mets to Pelvis, Skull, Left Ribs, Spine, Left Kidney CT scan Abdomen and Pelvis~Mets to Bladder, Lymph nodes, Prostate w/ extension to rectum, Left Kidney w/ mild hydronephrosis Started Casadex 12/14, Eligard shot 12/18

Posts.Content: Thanks wishbone. I will check out Dr. Charles Myer's site. The Oncologist we saw Wednesday is very Holistic and had some great suggestions for diet modifications~ raw foods and exercise.
